subject: Tracy Smith: Love Is On The Air
body:

April 13, 
      2007
 
Happy 
      Friday, 
 
As a 
      hopeless romantic, I love a good marriage proposal story. 
      
 
I 
      still get all giggly and, yes, sometimes teary, when I tell friends about 
      how, when I was in grad school, my then-boyfriend John used some elaborate 
      ruse to get me on a beach at sunrise in San Diego, where he grew up, gave 
      me a speech about how he made all the important decisions in his life on 
      that spot, then got down on one knee and shocked the wits out of me with a 
      proposal. Fifteen years later, I still thank God every day that I said 
      "yes."
 
So I 
      was tickled to hear the story of how our "Wedding in a Week" couple, Lisa Mayo & Stephen Wilfong, got engaged. 
      He literally wrote a fairy tale for her as his proposal — and with a 
      surprise ending! 
 
The big surprise is 
      that all next week, we'll be helping them get ready for their wedding, 
      with the "Rolls Royce of party
planners," as Julie called him, Colin Cowie. Colin will guide the 
      couple, all week long, as they select their attire, flowers, cake … even 
      jewelry. And on Friday, we'll pull it all together with a big, beautiful 
      ceremony, live on our show plaza and at the Hudson Hotel here in 
      New York 
      City. I'll be there, 
      teary, no doubt, and I hope you'll join us, 
      too.
 
Take 
      care,

Tracy 
      SmithEarlyShow@cbs.com
